intro: Seriania, commonly known as the false hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants in the mallow family, Malvaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are shrubs or small trees native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. The plants are characterized by their showy, five-petaled flowers that often display vibrant colors such as red, yellow, or orange. They typically have palmately lobed leaves and produce capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Seriania species are often cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
